definition.content: strategies, policies, decision-making structures and accountabilities through which addressing stakeholders assign and maintain addresses in a sustainable manner

examples.content: Citizens have an interest in addresses and are therefore addressing stakeholders, but they do not necessarily have any accountabilities in the governance framework.

notes.content: Not all addressing stakeholders are assigned tasks and responsibilities in the governance framework.
The requirements specified for a governance framework in this document are conditional requirements, i.e. they are required only if a governance framework is implemented.
Adapted for use in the addressing domain from ISO/IEC TR 38502:2017, 3.1.
